intro: Leptecophylla pendulosa, commonly known as the hanging leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its pendulous, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Native to South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardening.
